result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy Tovar Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.

DEF is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation and full payment of fine and costs.  DEF must petition court for full expungement, Court requests hearing to be set for expungement.

DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$498.50  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. records.addlTxt:
1:24 PM Defendant Tommy Tovar Thompson in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Tommy Tovar Thompson.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement.  All parties agree.  Court reviews the information filed, DEF enters Guilty plea.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 1 and finds DEF guilty of Count 1.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.   State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Attny Otten makes statement prior to sentencing.   DEF no comment.  Court makes statements prior to entering sentence, and addresses DEF regarding concerns with violation reports filed by Justice Point.  DEF responds.  Court to follow agreement.  


COURT:  withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Conditions of probation:  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through. AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Fine/Costs $748.50  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   DEF is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation and full payment of fine and costs.  DEF must petition court for full expungement, Court requests hearing to be set for expungement.   If revoked 21 days credit.
Review scheduled for October 7, 2025 at 09:00 am.
Supervision Report - Justice Point
DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty Otten acknowledged receipt of information.  DEF entered NG plea.

Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Moves to Arraignment.
